Dialogue: Well, why won't you come with us to South America? My fiancee won't mind,  Your dad would have wanted it.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Naw. Frank? Kill himself? You what?

Dialogue: Since when did he drink whisky?

Dialogue: No. I'll be off now. I should be at work.

Dialogue: Yeah,  Come off it, Eric. Who is it?

Dialogue: And you should know, if I remember rightly.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So you're doing all right then, Eric. You're making good.

Dialogue: Good prospects for advancement, is there? A pension?  Do you know, I'd almost forgotten what your eyes looked like.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't miss the start on my account.

Dialogue: Yes, I can see your problem, Mr Kinnear.

Dialogue: Sit down, Jack,  Glenda, get Jack a drink. What is it, Jack?

Dialogue: Do you know, I never knew he worked in one of my places!

Dialogue: No? Funny that. Neither did I.

Dialogue: Harry! Jack, I don't want to be rude, but these men have brought a lot of money with them. Glenda, you don't offer a man like Jack a drink in those piddling little glasses.  Give him the bloody bottle.  Now, where are we?

Speaker: kinnear
Dialogue: Oh... I think I'll stay as I am.

Speaker: kinnear
Dialogue: That's what you pay to find out. Right, Jack?

Dialogue: Right. If you can afford it.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Soon. When you've lost your money. Won't take long.

Dialogue: Harry, I don't like to push, but could you let us know how much your hand's worth?

Dialogue: That, Harry? That's another hundred - twenty-five pounds notes of the realm.

Dialogue: I'll follow that and go two hundred.

Speaker: kinnear
Dialogue: You can always see me, Harry.

Dialogue: Oh yes. When he came up on business.

Dialogue: I don't believe you, Margaret. Frank wasn't like that.  I'm the villain in the family, remember?

Dialogue: Listen, the only reason I came back to this craphole was to find out who did it. And I won't leave until I do. You understand?

Dialogue: Last night, after you'd gone, I did a little bit of asking around. Seeing as you weren't very forthcoming,  So I'm worried. I can't fight them I haven't that kind of set-up. But I've got to fix them before they fix me. Trouble is, if I try and they find out, I'm dead.

Speaker: brumby
Dialogue: Five grand. It belongs to you. Along with a little name I'm going to give you.

Speaker: brumby
Dialogue: Kinnear. Cyril Kinnear.  Kinnear did it.

Dialogue: I don't know. All I know is that people were shitting bricks up at his place last Saturday. Your brother's name was mentioned. Next day, he was dead.

Dialogue: I don't know. That's all I was told.

Dialogue: You couldn't win an egg and spoon race, Eric.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Stay away from the car or I'll blow you apart.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I bet you could use a drink, could you, Eric?

Speaker: eric
Dialogue: Still got your sense of humour.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Drink up, Eric. Drink up. I want you to drink all of that. Do you understand? Drink up. Just like it was with my brother, Frank. Go on, son. Drink up.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It was you who poured it down him. Eh, Eric?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Did you all have a good laugh, eh? Did you have a good laugh when he was spewing it up? The whisky is pouring all over Eric's face and suit.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Drink it! Drink it! Did you all pass the bottle round after the car went over the top?
